description:
An old stale tests.sqlite from a previous run_tests run can lead to unittest failure.
Workaround: run run_tests.sh with "-r" option to force DB recreation.

Maybe the DB should always be recreated (-r should be the default in run_tests)

Symptom:
The changes added in Revision 1219 are causing various unit tests to fail. This is the common error observed in all the dependent test cases

(nova.api.openstack): TRACE: OperationalError: (OperationalError) no such table: instance_type_extra_specs u'SELECT anon_1.instance_types_created_at AS anon_1_instance_types_created_at, anon_1.instance_types_updated_at AS anon_1_instance_types_updated_at, anon_1.instance_types_deleted_at AS anon_1_instance_types_deleted_at, anon_1.instance_types_deleted AS anon_1_instance_types_deleted, anon_1.instance_types_id AS anon_1_instance_types_id, anon_1.instance_types_name AS anon_1_instance_types_name, anon_1.instance_types_memory_mb AS anon_1_instance_types_memory_mb, anon_1.instance_types_vcpus AS anon_1_instance_types_vcpus, anon_1.instance_types_local_gb AS anon_1_instance_types_local_gb, anon_1.instance_types_flavorid AS anon_1_instance_types_flavorid, anon_1.instance_types_swap AS anon_1_instance_types_swap, anon_1.instance_types_rxtx_quota AS anon_1_instance_types_rxtx_quota, anon_1.instance_types_rxtx_cap AS anon_1_instance_types_rxtx_cap, instance_type_extra_specs_1.created_at AS instance_type_extra_specs_1_created_at, instance_type_extra_specs_1.updated_at AS instance_type_extra_specs_1_updated_at, instance_type_extra_specs_1.deleted_at AS instance_type_extra_specs_1_deleted_at, instance_type_extra_specs_1.deleted AS instance_type_extra_specs_1_deleted, instance_type_extra_specs_1.id AS instance_type_extra_specs_1_id, instance_type_extra_specs_1."key" AS instance_type_extra_specs_1_key, instance_type_extra_specs_1.value AS instance_type_extra_specs_1_value, instance_type_extra_specs_1.instance_type_id AS instance_type_extra_specs_1_instance_type_id \nFROM (SELECT instance_types.created_at AS instance_types_created_at, instance_types.updated_at AS instance_types_updated_at, instance_types.deleted_at AS instance_types_deleted_at, instance_types.deleted AS instance_types_deleted, instance_types.id AS instance_types_id, instance_types.name AS instance_types_name, instance_types.memory_mb AS instance_types_memory_mb, instance_types.vcpus AS instance_types_vcpus, instance_types.local_gb AS instance_types_local_gb, instance_types.flavorid AS instance_types_flavorid, instance_types.swap AS instance_types_swap, instance_types.rxtx_quota AS instance_types_rxtx_quota, instance_types.rxtx_cap AS instance_types_rxtx_cap \nFROM instance_types \nWHERE instance_types.flavorid = ? \n LIMIT 1 OFFSET 0) AS anon_1 LEFT OUTER JOIN instance_type_extra_specs AS instance_type_extra_specs_1 ON instance_type_extra_specs_1.instance_type_id = anon_1.instance_types_id AND instance_type_extra_specs_1.deleted = ?' (1, False)
(nova.api.openstack): TRACE:
--------------------- >> end captured logging << ---------------------

The primary test class affected by this change is nova.tests.api.openstack.test_servers.TestServerInstanceCreation.
In addition all the tests that require instance creation fail with similar error:

Eg: ERROR: test_snapshot_no_image_architecture (nova.tests.test_libvirt.LibvirtConnTestCase)

OperationalError: (OperationalError) table instances has no column named architecture u'INSERT INTO instances (created_at, updated_at, deleted_at, deleted, admin_pass, user_id, project_id, image_ref, kernel_id, ramdisk_id, launch_index, key_name, key_data, state, state_description, memory_mb, vcpus, local_gb, hostname, host, instance_type_id, user_data, reservation_id, mac_address, scheduled_at, launched_at, terminated_at, availability_zone, display_name, display_description, launched_on, locked, os_type, architecture, vm_mode, uuid) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?)' ('2011-06-29 07:03:52.512579', None, None, False, None, None, 'fake', '123456', None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, 2, None, None, None, '5', None, None, '02:12:34:46:56:67', None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, None, '3e6d089f-d5d0-40a2-be88-8ca15c67da76')
(nova.exception): TRACE:
--------------------- >> end captured logging << ---------------------
title: Stale (and not upgraded) tests.sqlite is causing unit tests to fail

comments.content:
The changes added in Revision 1219 are causing various unit tests to fail. This is the common error observed in all the dependent test cases

(nova.api.openstack): TRACE: OperationalError: (OperationalError) no such table: instance_type_extra_specs u'SELECT anon_1.instance_types_created_at AS anon_1_instance_types_created_at, anon_1.instance_types_updated_at AS anon_1_instance_types_updated_at, anon_1.instance_types_deleted_at AS anon_1_instance_types_deleted_at, anon_1.instance_types_deleted AS anon_1_instance_types_deleted, anon_1.instance_types_id AS anon_1_instance_types_id, anon_1.instance_types_name AS anon_1_instance_types_name, anon_1.instance_types_memory_mb AS anon_1_instance_types_memory_mb, anon_1.instance_types_vcpus AS anon_1_instance_types_vcpus, anon_1.instance_types_local_gb AS anon_1_instance_types_local_gb, anon_1.instance_types_flavorid AS anon_1.instance_types_id AND instance_type_extra_specs_1.deleted = ?' The primary test class affected by this change is nova.tests.api.openstack.test_servers.TestServerInstanceCreation. 
In addition all the tests that require instance creation fail with similar error:

Eg: ERROR: test_snapshot_no_image_architecture (nova.tests.test_libvirt.LibvirtConnTestCase)

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rohitk

comments.content:
Openstack jenkins nova-coverage job has also been failing with these errors:

http://jenkins.openstack.org/view/Nova/job/nova-coverage/873/console
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rohitk

comments.content:
Can't reproduce that locally... and Jenkins passes unit tests alright as well.

Did you upgrade your database ? rev1219 introduces a schema change, maybe you should "sudo nova-manage db sync"...
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: Note that nova-coverage job was fixed by forcing it to use the latest DB model....
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: Ok, I am performing these changes on a local setup, and will update this section.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rohitk

comments.content: This was database sync issue. I have modified the job appropriately. Thank you!
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rohitk

comments.content:
This still fails when updating an existing branch. But a fresh 'bzr branch' works ok.

So, if I 'bzr merge lp:nova' into my existing work branch, the tests fall apart because the db migrations are not being performed.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sandy-walsh

comments.content: I too used the new -r option in the Jenkins job to delete the tests db and recreate it. Making it default for Jenkins job would prevent any unit test breakage due to schema changes in future.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rohitk

comments.content:
Maybe we should also add the check for existence of tests.sqlite to avoid the "rm: cannot remove `tests.sqlite': No such file or directory" error on a fresh branch.

if [ $recreate_db -eq 1 ]; then
    if [ -e tests.sqlite ]; then
        rm tests.sqlite
    fi
fi
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~rohitk

comments.content: I created bug 803861 to track the spurious "No such file or directory" error.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx
